oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from William Thompson to his sister
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On 16 May 1863, Confederate soldier William Thompson writes to his sister from a "camp near Shelbyville" after battle near Chancellorsville, "The glorious news from the East is dimmed by the accompanying intelligence of the death of that noble old hero Stonewall. Though it is a severe blow to our cause these all will go well while Gen. Lee is safe.""It remains to be seen what effect the late defeat (Chancellorsville) will have on the Northern mind."
